alert.note: Alert for Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 20 at 7:48AM PST until December 20 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Freezing rain could create a thin layer of ice. * WHERE...Valleys of Jackson and Josephine County, including Hayes Hill, Jacksonville Hill, and the lower passes north of Grants Pass along I-5. * WHEN...From 10 AM to 1 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Ice will create slippery and hazardous road conditions, which may impact the morning commute. This could also create a slip hazard on walkways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The potential for ice development will last until the air temperature warms above freezing. This will take at least until 10 AM, but pockets of cold air may retain any ice beyond then. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Jackson County
